data.shownotes:
Before Gamma Knife, Cavs teased Rock With You (Michael Jackson). The Lord of Lightning and the Altered Beast suite were introduced as new songs and contained alternate lyrics. Invisible Face was incomplete. Only Part I of The River was performed. Wah Wah contained The River quotes.

**KGLW.net Staff Notes:** This show is notable for being the only known performance where the band played through the entire set without any stops.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show may be incomplete. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media and there are no known audio or video recordings. If anyone has any information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show may be incomplete. Nuclear Fusion and most of the Altered Beast suite were confirmed by audio/video and the remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Nuclear Fusion, Altered Beast II and the segue between Altered Beast III and Robot Stop were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The Lord of Lightning, Rattlesnake and the segue between Cellophane and Altered Beast II were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

Cellophane contained I'm In Your Mind and I'm Not In Your Mind teases. Am I In Heaven? was played for the first time since 2016-05-14. (70 show gap) KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Billabong Valley and Rattlesnake were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through the written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. All songs aside from Anoxia, Invisible Face and Gamma Knife through Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

All Is Known was introduced as a new song and contained alternate lyrics. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Open Water through Rattlesnake were confirmed by the band's Facebook livestream and the Altered Beast suite was confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

Crosstown Traffic (The Jimi Hendrix Experience) played before and as the band walked on stage for the second set. The Altered Beast suite and The Balrog were introduced as new songs. Before Alter Me I, the band took a moment to fix loud buzzing coming from Ambrose's equipment. Invisible Face was incomplete. Am I In Heaven? contained Alter Me and Cellophane teases and quotes, Rattlesnake, Hot Water, and Head On/Pill teases, and a Sea Of Trees jam with lyrics. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Alter Me I through Am I In Heaven? were confirmed by the band's Facebook livestream. The remaining songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

High Voltage (AC/DC) played before and as the band walked on stage for the first set. All Is Known was introduced as a new song and contained alternate lyrics. During Billabong Valley, the guitar strap fell off the Flying Microtonal Banana while Ambrose was using it, with Joey jokingly telling Stu afterwards that his guitar was broken and that Ambrose should "stick to the blues harp". NOBODY'S BABY (Sheer Mag) played before and as the band walked on stage for the second set. Before Gamma Knife, the crowd started chanting for Stu to do a "shoey", to which he told them to "be reasonable" and that he was "too old for that". The Balrog was introduced as a new song. Am I In Heaven? contained a medley of teases and quotes including Alter Me, Cellophane, Rattlesnake, Hot Water, Head On/Pill and The River as well as a Sea of Trees jam with lyrics. This performance was filmed in 360-degree video and released as "King Gizzard & The Lizard Wizard - 360° Full Concert" on the Banalarama YouTube channel, featuring audio mixed by Stu
Webcast live by Pitchfork. Night one was performed in the grand ballroom.

This show featured the debut of Vomit Coffin. Following Rattlesnake, the band wished a happy birthday to Eric. Am I In Heaven? contained teases and quotes of Cellophane, The River, Head On/Pill, I'm In Your Mind, Sea of Trees, Rattlesnake, and Robot Stop. Prior to the show, Stu accidentally posted a link containing demos for all of Polygondwanaland to the Facebook fan page under the name “Blinky Bill”. Although removed shortly after, someone was able to download the first two demos causing Stu to message them claiming he was a fan named Han-Tyumi and asked for the demos not to be reposted. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but no recordings are available. KGLW.net staff believes the setlist is complete based on contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.showtitle: Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival

data.shownotes: Webcast on Red Bull.tv and YouTube

The power went out during Robot Stop, leading to a few minute delay. During Am I In Heaven?, Stu crowd surfs to the Soundboard to high five Sammy, during which the band jams. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. If anyone has any additional information on what was played at this show or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

data.showtitle: This Is Not A Love Song Festival

data.shownotes: During final song Stu crowd surfed out of the venue and into the sea, while the band continued to play.
Poster by Olya Dyer, limited to 100
Performed at the William's Green stage.
John Peel set

This show featured the debuts of Some Context, Welcome to an Altered Future, Digital Black, and Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg. Billabong Valley was dedicated to Charles Bradley, who had passed that day. Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer was played for the first time known since 2015-09-11. (174 show gap) Robot Stop contained a Master Of The Universe' jam with lyrics.

Members of Mild High Club joined the band for Countdown and Rolling Stoned. Countdown was performed without the keyboard solo as the band forgot to play it. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. The Lord of Lightning, Sleep Drifter, Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer, Robot Stop, Countdown and Rolling Stoned were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Members of Mild High Club joined the band for Countdown and Rolling Stoned. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Rattlesnake, Countdown and Rolling Stoned were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The first performance of Rolling Stoned was played as the last song of Mild High Club's set, with the members of King Gizzard joining in mid-song. Robot Stop contained a Master of the Universe jam with lyrics. Members of Mild High Club joined the band for Countdown and the second performance of Rolling Stoned. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Sleep Drifter, Rattlesnake, Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer, Robot Stop through Gamma Knife, Countdown and both performances of Rolling Stoned were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
The band walked out to Let There Be Rock by AC/DC.
Robot Stop contained a Master Of The Universe jam with lyrics.
Am I In Heaven? contained People Vultures, Cut Throat Boogie, Rattlesnake, Alter Me, Robot Stop, Cellophane, I'm In Your Mind, Head On/Pill, and Float Along - Fill Your Lungs teases and quotes.

This was an appearance for radio station KEXP in Seattle. The performance was held for a live audience at the KEXP Gathering Space and was hosted by KEXP DJ Cheryl Waters. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg featured Stu on flute and alternate lyrics.

I'm In Your Mind Fuzz was played for the first time known since 2016-08-19. (106 show gap) Crumbling Castle was played for the first time known since 2016-09-08. (88 show gap) Robot Stop contained a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Crumbling Castle was confirmed by video. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net

Headline set at Gizzfest Sydney 2017. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.
Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2017-12-02. (57 show gap)
Sleep Drifter contained an intro jam and a Billabong Valley Tease.

Am I In Heaven? contained Alter Me I, Hot Water, Head On/Pill, Stressin' and Robot Stop teases and quotes. Muddy Water featured Adam Halliwell on flute. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Venusian 2, Am I In Heaven?, This Thing, Work This Time, Cyboogie, Altered Beast IV, Muddy Water, Melting and Self-Immolate have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Mars For The Rich was introduced as a song about communism, followed by an audience member pulling the fire alarm which proceeded to go off for the next few songs. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Cellophane, Inner Cell through People-Vultures and Planet B through The River were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Only Part I of The River was performed and it contained Wah Wah teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes. During The Cruel Millennial and The Wheel, Ambrose wore an audience member's fishie helmet. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Planet B and Plastic Boogie through Self-Immolate were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star played through the PA speakers as the band came on stage. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Robot Stop teases. Wah Wah contained The River intro and teases. Cut Throat Boogie contained The Cruel Millennial outro. Head On/Pill featured Rattlesnake, Mr. Beat and Sea of Trees teases, Robot Stop, Hot Water, and Am I In Heaven? teases and quotes, and Hot Wax quotes. Stu played drums for part of Head On/Pill, with Amby on lead vocals and guitar, and Cavs on keys. Cavs also began diving into the crowd and crowdsurfing during the time when Stu was on drums. Muddy Water was on the setlist, but not played. 'Murder of the Universe' and parts of the 'Head On/Pill' jam from this show are featured in the 'Chunky Shrapnel' concert film.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 400

Stu and Ambrose wished Joey a happy birthday during The Dripping Tap. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Oddlife was introduced as “Cookie’s favorite song”. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to soundman Sam Joseph and contained Cut Throat Boogie teases/quotes, “My Babe” (Little Walter), “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole), and “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes and Sleepwalker teases. Sea of Trees was introduced as “what King Gizzard was originally called” and “Lucas’s favorite song”, and contained Head On/Pill and The Bitter Boogie teases. Hypertension was played over the PA as the setbreak music, which incidentally served as the “debut” for the studio track. I’m Not in Your Mind contained Alter Me teases. A New World through Altered Beast III featured Leah Senior providing narration. Alter Me I contained an Altered Beast III tease. Alter Me II and Altered Beast III were played for the first time since 2019-10-07 (90 show gap). The intro to Iron Lung featured additional vocals about “hot buns”. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Iron Lung was reprised during Mr. Beat. Joey was hit with silly string at the conclusion of the show, and Ambrose quoted “Happy Birthday, Lisa” (The Simpsons) for the second night in a row. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea

“Theme from Halloween” was played over the PA prior to the costumed band members walking on stage to a song played over the PA: "P.I.M.P" (50 Cent) for Ambrose, dressed as a pimp, "Mother" (Danzig) for Cavs, dressed as Glenn Danzig, "You've Got a Friend in Me" (Randy Newman) for Lucas, dressed as Buzz Lightyear, ""C" is for Cookie" (Sesame Street) for Cook, dressed as a cookie, with him throwing cookies into the crowd, "Oompa Loompa (#1)" (Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory) for Joey, dressed as an Oompa Loompa, and "Hollaback Girl" (Gwen Stefani) for Stu, dressed as a banana and throwing bananas into the crowd. Additionally, crew for the show were dressed as ketchup and mustard bottles. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Alter Me was teased during the intro to People-Vultures. Mr. Beat contained a Persistence tease. Before Alter Me II, there was an extended discussion about bananas. Alter Me II through Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior (dressed as a witch) providing the narration. The verses were sung out of order in Altered Beast IV. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Before Doom City, Stu denied a fan request for Catching Smoke saying that they didn’t know how to play it. Magenta Mountain featured a lyric change to reference Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory. Stu removed the banana costume prior to Self-Immolate and threw it into the crowd, citing that it was “too hot”. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band in which Ambrose destroyed pumpkins that were on stage and threw the pieces into the crows. Poster by Jake Foreman

The Wheel was played for the first time since Dec. 19, 2021 (94 show gap). Alter Me III contained Witchcraft teases. Altered Beast IV contained Converge teases. Sadie Sorceress was dedicated to Ambrose's 99-year-old grandmother and contained an extra verse from The Grim Reaper and quotes of Torture Chamber. Am I In Heaven? contained “animals in Australia” lyrics, Witchcraft teases, Head On/Pill teases, Ice V teases, Hot Water teases, Shanghai teases, The Dripping Tap teases, I Am Not a Man Unless I Have a Woman quotes and Sea of Trees teases. Poster By Jason Galea 100 Standard / 30 Foil

Altered Beast III, Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2023-03-23 (115 shows).  Before Stressin', Stu teased Bullet in the Head (Rage Against The Machine). The Book was introduced a song about ancient stuff and featured a short drum solo. Hot Water was played in an alternate synth version for the first time. After Mirage City, Joey shouted out opener King Stingray and thanked guitarist Roy Kellaway for the Yothu Yindi shirt he was wearing. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Crumbling Castle teases and Alter Me teases and quotes. Sea of Trees contained Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases, Ice V teases, an Alter Me outro, and the second verse was changed to "I'm feeling kinda shit... but I've got my mates with me and I guess that is that, that’s that". Work This Time contained Mars For The Rich teases.

Show poster by Jason Galea - Edition of 100
